reviews.review_msg: Professor Gulmanelli is one of the most reasonable profs I've had in a while. I especially appreciate how he will talk about the content then assign related readings after so the readings are easier to process. The discussion follows the next week and it makes things so much easier. He sets you up to learn and gives room for exploration.

Highly recommend NOT taking any courses w him. A topic which could've been quite engaging and interesting, turned into a purely theoretical 4h weekly rant. He didn't hold office hours and was not accessible outside of class for clarification or questions- emails made for difficult conversations too. An inconsistent marker and at times even rude.

Stay away from this professor, TERRIBLE TERRIBLE MARKER. Totally unfair. Lectures are unbearably boring. I am an upper division student nearly finishing my BA and have never done so poorly in a course, despite the handwork and effort. AVOID HIM IF YOU WANT A GOOD MARK TO COME WITH YOUR HARD WORK.

Not necessarily a tough grader, but gives you little to no guidance regarding assignments. If you ask him for further clarification he says 'he has no requirements' but when you get your grade... you see his requirements are very specific. He has no patience if you need help with assignments.
Very tough marker and extremely boring lecturer, he just reads off the slides for hours. Far from inspirational but expects your work to be inspired. Save your GPA and avoid him.
